00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements functions that require complex inputs
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Function::complex;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the argument is complex, and
00011 #    mark the result as real or complex, as appropriate.
00012 #
00013 sub _check {
00014   my $self = shift;
00015   return $self->checkComplex(@_) if $self->{def}{complex};
00016   return $self->checkReal(@_);
00017 }
00018 
00019 #
00020 #  Evaluate by calling the appropriate routine from Value.pm.
00021 #
00022 sub _eval {
00023   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00024   my $c = shift; my $context = (Value::isValue($c) ? $c : $self)->context;
00025   $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$c)->$name;
00026 }
00027 
00028 #
00029 #  Check for the right number of arguments.
00030 #  Convert argument to a complex (does error checking)
00031 #    and then call the appropriate routine from Value.pm.
00032 #
00033 sub _call {
00034   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00035   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too many inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) > 1;
00036   Value::Error("Function '%s' has too few inputs",$name) if scalar(@_) == 0;
00037   my $c = shift; my $context = (Value::isValue($c) ? $c : $self)->context;
00038   $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$c)->$name;
00039 }
00040 
00041 ##################################################
00042 #
00043 #  Sepcifal versions of sqrt, log and ^ that are used
00044 #  in the Complex context.
00045 #
00046 
00047 #
00048 #  Subclass of fumeric functions that promote negative reals
00049 #  to complex before performing the function (so that sqrt(-2)
00050 #  is defined, for example).
00051 #
00052 package Parser::Function::complex_numeric;
00053 use strict;
00054 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function::numeric);
00055 
00056 sub sqrt {
00057   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00058   my $x = Value::makeValue(shift,context=>$context);
00059   $x = $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$x)
00060     if $x->value < 0 && $self->{def}{negativeIsComplex};
00061   $x->sqrt;
00062 }
00063 
00064 sub log {
00065   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00066   my $x = Value::makeValue(shift,$context);
00067   $x = $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$x)
00068     if $x->value < 0 && $self->{def}{negativeIsComplex};
00069   $x->log;
00070 }
00071 
00072 #
00073 #  Special power operator that promotes negative real
00074 #  bases to complex numbers before taking power (so that
00075 #  (-3)^(1/2) is defined, for example).
00076 #
00077 package Parser::Function::complex_power;
00078 use strict;
00079 our @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP::power Parser::BOP);
00080 
00081 sub _eval {
00082   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00083   my $a = Value::makeValue(shift,context=>$context); my $b = shift;
00084   $a = $self->Package("Complex")->promote($context,$a)
00085     if Value::isReal($a) && $a->value < 0 && $self->{def}{negativeIsComplex};
00086   return $a ** $b;
00087 }
